comprehensive_overview: Wannier90 is a tool used for the computation of maximally-localized Wannier functions, which are spatially compact and localized functions that provide a natural description of the electronic structure of a solid. These functions are often used in condensed matter physics calculations to study the electronic properties of materials.
core_features:
1. Computation of maximally-localized Wannier functions
2. Calculation of Wannier centers and spreads
3. Generation of Wannier interpolation grids
4. Interface with various electronic structure codes
5. Post-processing and analysis functionalities
